symbols.docstring: Create and return a database connection.

symbols.name: User
symbols.docstring: User class for Flask-Login

symbols.name: load_user
symbols.docstring: Load user by ID for Flask-Login

symbols.name: generate_available_periods
symbols.docstring:
Generate list of available periods (last 6 months + next 6 months).
Returns list of strings in format 'YYYY-MM'.

symbols.name: get_task_counts
symbols.docstring:
Get counts of pending, problem, completed tasks, and pending alerts.
Returns dict with 'pending', 'problems', 'completed', 'alerts' counts.

symbols.name: generate_alerts
symbols.docstring:
Generate pending alerts based on alert_settings configuration.
Creates one alert per task_type (not per section).
This function should be run periodically (daily) to create alerts.

Args:
    reference_date: Date to use as reference (default: today)

Returns:
    dict with stats: {'generated': count, 'skipped': count, 'errors': [], 'email_stats': {...}}

symbols.name: check_alert_day
symbols.docstring:
Check if the reference_date matches the alert configuration.

Args:
    reference_date: date object to check
    frequency: alert frequency (daily, weekly, biweekly, monthly, quarterly, semiannual, annual)
    alert_day: specific day configuration (day of week or day of month)

Returns:
    bool: True if alert should be generated for this date

symbols.name: send_email_notifications
symbols.docstring:
Send email notifications for newly generated alerts.

Args:
    alert_list: List of dicts with keys: task_type_name, due_date, etc.

Returns:
    dict with stats: {'sent': count, 'failed': count, 'errors': []}

symbols.name: inject_task_counts
symbols.docstring: Make task counts available to all templates

symbols.name: format_date
symbols.docstring: Format date string to Spanish format: dd/mm/yyyy

symbols.name: format_period
symbols.docstring: Format period string from '2025-11' to 'Noviembre 2025'

symbols.name: pendientes
symbols.docstring:
List of ALL pending tasks (not marked as OK or Problem)
Generates all possible combinations and excludes completed/problem tasks

symbols.name: problemas
symbols.docstring:
List of tasks with problems (status='problem')
Shows tasks from 2025-10 onwards that have issues

symbols.name: realizadas
symbols.docstring:
List of completed tasks (status='ok')
Shows complete history of all tasks marked as OK

symbols.name: configuracion
symbols.docstring: Configuration page - CRUD for URLs, Alerts and Notification preferences

Update task status (ok/problem) via AJAX

symbols.name: save_observations

Save observations for all tasks of a section (when there are problems)

symbols.name: save_alert_settings

Save alert settings for all task types
Expects JSON: [{ task_type_id, alert_frequency, alert_day, enabled }, ...]

Manually trigger alert generation for testing.
Can accept optional date parameter (YYYY-MM-DD format).

Display ALL alerts (both active and dismissed)
One alert per task_type, not per section

symbols.name: should_create_task_for_period
symbols.docstring:
Determina si se debe crear una tarea para un periodo dado según su periodicidad.

Args:
    period: Periodo en formato "YYYY-MM" (ej: "2025-11")
    periodicity: Tipo de periodicidad ("weekly", "monthly", "quarterly", "biannual", "yearly")

Returns:
    True si se debe crear la tarea, False si no

symbols.name: create_tasks_for_period
symbols.docstring:
Crea tareas para un periodo específico según las periodicidades configuradas.

Args:
    period: Periodo en formato "YYYY-MM" (ej: "2025-11")
    db_path: Ruta a la base de datos SQLite
    verbose: Si True, muestra mensajes de progreso

symbols.docstring: Muestra estadísticas de tareas en la BD.

symbols.name: generate_section_name
symbols.docstring:
Genera un nombre descriptivo para la sección a partir de la URL.

Args:
    url: URL completa (ej: "https://www.r4.com/planes-de-pensiones/categorias")
    hierarchy_levels: Lista de niveles de jerarquía (Col 2-6)

Returns:
    Nombre descriptivo (ej: "Planes de Pensiones - Categorías")

symbols.name: load_sections_from_excel
symbols.docstring:
Lee el Excel y carga las secciones (URLs) en la base de datos.

Args:
    excel_path: Ruta al archivo Excel
    db_path: Ruta a la base de datos SQLite
